Budget Amendment Form
Amendment Home to School Transport – Feasibility Amendment 2
Name: Study Number:
Directorate: Children, Young People & Education
Proposer: Mark Hood Seconder: Barry Lewis
Proposed Purpose:
Allocate up to £75k from the money earmarked for general reserves to fund a comprehensive feasibility study into cost
effective ways of providing home to school transport by exploring (among other things) in-house options and practices
used outside of the UK.

text:
Budget Amendment Form
Amendment Home to School Transport – Feasibility Amendment 2
Name: Study Number:
Directorate: Children, Young People & Education
Proposer: Mark Hood Seconder: Barry Lewis
Proposed Purpose:
Allocate up to £75k from the money earmarked for general reserves to fund a comprehensive feasibility study into cost
effective ways of providing home to school transport by exploring (among other things) in-house options and practices
used outside of the UK. This study would solely be to look at Home to School transport for children in mainstream
education.
Proposed Amount Proposed Funding Source:
£75k Reduce Contribution to General Reserves
